column4: How do I install a theme? I have some files downloaded in a rar file..
114151-Darkside.rar does not appear to be a valid theme.
sometimes creators put multiple theme files (like metacity and gtk) into one archved file so check if the theme files are in the archieve by unpacking a copy of the rar in a tmp folder
There is a file called deco_3 (.png files in there) and a file called darkside.qtcurve and darkside.colors
There is a file called deco_3 (.png files in there) and a file called darkside.qtcurve and darkside.colors
if the theme is right for your distro put it in a folder named for your theme and put it in /home/you/.themes
What do you mean by distro?
if its a wrong theme it won't work but how do you know 'till you try it eh?
kicker is the way the applications or start button presents itself I thinK.
Okay, a stupid question perhaps.. I skipped the themes I've downloaded so far.. and now i'm on gnome-look.org.. Where is the themes at? GTK 2.x or GDM Themes??
you need to know what you are running for a window decorator then go to the gtk or metacity themes for desktop themes. gdm is login screens and themes
I have no clue? I'm running Ubuntu 9.10? and one of their standard themes.
you need compz  fusion icon to check for what window decorator you are running.
check synaptic for compiz fusion icon, download, run it and choose window decorator from that menu
